cyclone.name: HERMINE
cyclone.current_location: about 420 miles SSW of Apalachicola, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: expected to turn north then northeast and accelerate toward the northwest Florida Big-Bend coast and then move up the U.S. southeast coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Big Bend area of northwest Florida (between Anclote River and Indian Pass)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch from Anclote River to Indian Pass, FL; Tropical Storm Watch west of Indian Pass to the Walton/Bay County line, FL
weather_observation.warning_coast: None in effect (only watches issued so far)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Gulf Coast (Big Bend), then Atlantic coasts of GA/SC/NC later in the period
weather_observation.wind: Only a slight chance (â‰¤4%) of brief tropical-storm-force gusts; prevailing winds expected below 30 mph.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected along Plaquemines Parish shoreline from this system.
weather_observation.rainfall: Scattered outer-band showers possible; totals generally below 1 inch.
weather_observation.other_hazards: None anticipated that would significantly impact port operations.
